function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Encouraging waste collection through incentives may lead to increased human contact with waste, increasing the risk of exposure to contagious diseases.","Impact":"Higher risk of contagious diseases spreading within the community.","Mitigation":"Implement strict hygiene measures and waste treatment protocols to minimize the risk of disease transmission.","Technologies":"Waste treatment facilities, personal protective equipment, sanitation technologies.","People":"Local community members, waste collection workers.","Owner":"Local authorities, waste management organizations."},{"Description":"Illegal wildlife trade and captivity practices in the Amazon may contribute to the spread of zoonotic diseases and threaten public health.","Impact":"Increased risk of zoonotic disease transmission from wildlife to humans.","Mitigation":"Enforce strict regulations against wildlife trade and captivity, support wildlife conservation and reintroduction programs, and raise awareness about the public health risks associated with wildlife trade.","Technologies":"Surveillance technology, wildlife tracking devices, public health campaigns.","People":"Local communities, wildlife traders, tourists.","Owner":"Government authorities, conservation organizations."},{"Description":"Former hunters, now working as wildlife keepers, may still pose a risk of disease transmission due to their previous hunting activities and close contact with wildlife.","Impact":"Increased risk of zoonotic disease transmission to wildlife keepers and the community.","Mitigation":"Provide education and training on disease prevention and safe wildlife handling practices, conduct regular health screenings for wildlife keepers, and promote the use of personal protective equipment.","Technologies":"Training programs, health screening tools, personal protective equipment.","People":"Former hunters turned wildlife keepers, local communities.","Owner":"Conservation organizations, public health authorities."}]}
